The Lithuanian SSR was a socialist state and was governed by the Communist Party of Lithuania, which was subordinate to the Communist Party of the Soviet Union. The Lithuanian SSR was a member of the Soviet Union and was responsible for the administration of the territory of Lithuania. The Lithuanian SSR was dissolved in 1990 after the collapse of the Soviet Union.
